maptool.postcode_editor.routes

Module Contents

Functions

postcode()

When user submits postal code in gui we return all versions

postcodeAllPlzIds()

fetches all postcode ids for which results already exist in the database

postcodePlzVersion()

fetched from the postcode version select gui, caches the selected network version and tries to generate a network grid for it

postcodeReturnAreaBoundary()

called if the user uses an id to define network area, returns the area's boundary shape for display on the GUI map

postcodeFetchNetsForID()

the JS Fetch API sends a POST request once the user has selected one of the preview nets

postcodeAreaReturnBuildings()

called if the user uses a shape to define a new network area, fetches all buildings within the area and returns them to the frontend

postcodeAreaCreateNewGridFromBuildings()

called once the user has finished deleting buildings in the frontend. It extracts the osmID of each building
maptool.postcode_editor.routes.postcode()

When user submits postal code in gui we return all versions of the id for which networks are found in the database

Returns:

list of all versions

Return type:

list[string]

maptool.postcode_editor.routes.postcodeAllPlzIds()

fetches all postcode ids for which results already exist in the database

:return list of all plz ids :rtype list[int]

maptool.postcode_editor.routes.postcodePlzVersion()

fetched from the postcode version select gui, caches the selected network version and tries to generate a network grid for it

Returns:

response indicating whether a network grid of the requested version already exists

Return type:

JavaScript Fetch API Response

maptool.postcode_editor.routes.postcodeReturnAreaBoundary()

called if the user uses an id to define network area, returns the area’s boundary shape for display on the GUI map

Returns:

a geoJSON feature dict containing the shape information of the area boundary

Return type:

dict

maptool.postcode_editor.routes.postcodeFetchNetsForID()

the JS Fetch API sends a POST request once the user has selected one of the preview nets The request includes the kcid and bcid of the chosen network

Returns:

response indicating successful data transfer

Return type:

JavaScript Fetch API Response

the JS Fetch API sends a GET request immediately after receiving and displaying the boundary area shape of a PLZ region

Returns:

a list geojson featurecollections of all networks associated with the id the user selected

Return type:

list

maptool.postcode_editor.routes.postcodeAreaReturnBuildings()

called if the user uses a shape to define a new network area, fetches all buildings within the area and returns them to the frontend

Returns:

dict containing geoJSON feature objects for residential buildings and other buildings. The geoJSON objects also hold each building’s osmID

Return type:

dict

maptool.postcode_editor.routes.postcodeAreaCreateNewGridFromBuildings()

called once the user has finished deleting buildings in the frontend. It extracts the osmID of each building sent from the frontend, separates them into residential and other buildings and calls the pylovo functions necessary for generating a new grid

Returns:

response indicating whether a new network grid was sucessfully created

Return type:

JavaScript Fetch API Response
